Text.Text: [The player just walked up to Oswald, surprising him while he was lost in thought]Oh!  [Regains composure]My apologies... I didn't see you standing there.  What can I do for you?  [Confused, not sure if player already asked him to do something]Or was there something I was supposed to do for you?
[A little puzzled, staring at the player as if trying to remember]Perhaps... yes, yes, I think I would have remembered you.  I'm sure of it.  I think.

[Forgot to introduce himself, slightly apologetic]Introductions, of course, introductions.  [Explaining]Sometimes the ideas will start rattling around in my head, and I'll wake up to find I'm somewhere else.  [Thinks.]Or talking to someone else.

My name's Fiddlebender.  [Ooops. Forgot to say my first name]Oswald, that is.  [Explains]Well, Fiddlebender's my *last* name, my first name is Oswald, so it's Oswald Fiddlebender.  [Extends his hand]A pleasure to meet you.

[Embarrassed]Oh, my!  Did I borrow such a sum?  [Searches pockets, realizes he has no cash]I'm afraid you caught me a little short at the moment, [feels he needs to explain]not height-wise, mind you, but you know, light in the purse.
[Has an idea!]Oh, but wait!  Would you settle for one of my concoctions instead?  I just brewed it, and I'm almost completely certain it's quite potent... [Thinks.]whatever it does.
Ship?  [Points at huge ship right next to him]Oh, you mean this one here?

[Rocks back on forth on heels smugly, put emphasis on air ship]You mean my *air ship.*  [Proud]Yes, yes, indeed, it's mine.  Beautiful, isn't it?  [Smug, emphasizing specialness of airship]Didn't know which ship you meant at first, for there are many *common* ships about, but this one is *quite* extraordinary.
[Explains]Most ships travel upon the water.  This one, however... [dramatic pause]travels upon the *air.*
[Explains]Indeed it does!  It was wondrous... well, before it crashed in [Tar-gohs]Targos... I flew it all the way from [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar, you know.
[Looks where player is pointing]Oh, yes, the damage there - well, the landing here in [Tar-gohs]Targos was somewhat bumpy, and it took some time to put out the flames and mend the wooden frame.
[Continues, calmly describing the disaster]And of course, there were all those potions that shattered in the crash and caused those nasty fires on the northern side of town.

[Continues, calmly describing the disaster]Fortunately, all the residents had already fled at my approach, so it was only a matter of time before the flames died down and we could approach the ship.  [Optimistically cheerful]Quite a mess, but we got it all sorted out.

[Brightens, proud]Oh, well, now *that's* another story.  [Proud]Had to fashion a spell of my own to mend the ship - "Oswald's Mending," I call it, quite catchy I think.  [Frowns]Getting the components for it can be quite exhausting, let alone remembering them - wrote it all down in a book in the lab.

[Ticking them off on his fingers]Hmmm... let's see... there's spider silk - fresh spider silk, mind you, not old - [bella-donna]belladonna paste, crushed diamonds, some [thrim]thrym extract, a little bit of iron ore, some wood, of course - unless you crashed on a house or near a big tree, in which case that isn't a problem - and um, well, can't remember the last bits, but I have it all written down.
[Ironic foreshadowing, since the ship's going to crash not long after the player gets up into it.]Very true, very true.  Can't see this airship crashing anytime in the near future.  Sturdy as a rock.
Well, of course they can.  Just get a giant to throw them, and even the largest stone will fly like a bird.  [Explains]A very heavy bird, mind you, and no wings, but the principle is the same.

[Oh, well...]Why, I live in [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar with my niece, [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie - I mean, well, I set up shop there after I landed in town... well, crashed, really, but that's neither here nor there.

[Explains, but not complaining]There's an awful lot of mountains around [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar.  Very confusing to fly through.  Or around.  It's hard to steer this ship when I'm in the lab, I've discovered.
[Brightens up, really likes Maralie]Oh, yes, [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie.  Quite the Fiddlebender as Fiddlebenders go.  She's growing like a quick weed - she's almost up to my knee.
[Brightens up]Oh, didn't I tell you?  [Frowns.]But I must have.
[Brightens up]Why, I make potions!  I mean, well, among other things.  I'm an inventor.  I make things.  And potions.  [Confused]Did I say that?
Most certainly.  I'd be more than happy to supply you with whatever potions you might need... at a fair price, of course.
[Misses insult.]Not often.  Very dangerous, some of them.  Others are volatile.  [Pauses]Some are both.
Of course!  [Thinks]Well, no, I mean, I'm part of the [Tar-gohs]Targos Guard.  A scout, you see.  An *aerial* scout.

A lot of goblins mostly.  [Remembers the goblins shoot a lot of arrows at his ship]Those goblins shoot a lot of arrows, you know.[Nods knowingly.]  I've told them to stop it on many occasions, but they only seem to understand after I dump several casks of flaming oil on them.

Well - everywhere.  Quite a mob of them.  [Uhl-brek]Ulbrec, he's the lord of the town you know, has asked me to look for large concentrations of them and report back, which I am more than happy to do... helps pay for the damage to the town when my airship landed.
Oh, you'll have to wait - there's another group I have to take to the Western Pass first.  To meet up with the Neverwinter forces, you know.

Are you sure?  [Squints]Well, you know, you must be.  I'm quite sure Lord [Uhl-brek]Ulbrec wouldn't make a mistake like that.  [A little eager]Are you ready to leave now?  I can cast off immediately, if you like.
Hmmm.  You know, and I'm saying this simply because, well, it *could* happen, but we might not be able to come back to [Tar-gohs]Targos.  [Pause]For some time.
Yes, as in, not at all.  So I wouldn't leave anything behind.  Bring everything you need.  Especially warm cloaks.  Very cold in the Western Pass, as I understand it.

Well, you know, accidents happen, and the wind's awfully strong... in any event, I just wanted to make sure you were ready.  [Pause, continues]And had everything.  [Pause, explains]In case we never come back.  [Pause, explains]To [Tar-gohs]Targos, that is.
Very well.  I'll be here - just let me know when you want to leave, and, well, we'll depart.
Oh!  Hello.  [A little eager]Are you ready to leave?  [A little less eager]Or were you just looking to buy some potions?
[Pleased to see the player]Ah, welcome back!  Something I can help you with?  A potion to put some color in your cheeks, perhaps?
[Low trance-like sound]Ohmmmmmmmm...

[Annoyed and confused]Huh?!  What?!  [Waking up, seeing the player, frantically trying to gain his bearing]Oh!  Pardon me... I must've fallen asleep again.  [Chuckling and relieved, eyes still blurry]Phew, good thing we weren't flying at the time...

[Overjoyed]Thank you!  [Fondly reminiscing what he saw during his trance]It was simply beautiful... [feeling the need to explain]the trance I mean, not the crash... [Continuing the memory]I was a baby [kr'-kan]kraken, swimming through river clouds of soft, molten gemstone.  [Drifting back to reality, explaining]Those episodes are rare, but have happened before - well, usually right after a crash.
Most certainly.  I'd be more than happy to supply you with whatever potions you might need... at a fair price, of course.
Why, hello again!  Can I help you with anything else?

[Happy to show off his skills and redeem himself]Indeed!  I can make lightweight plate mail in one day, field plate in two, or full plate armor in three - all for a reasonable price.  Which would you like?

[Happy to show off his skills and redeem himself]Absolutely!  I can make *beautiful* clothing thick enough to ward off this winter chill.  What would you like?  Boots?  A cloak?  Perhaps a scarf or hat?  Are gloves more to your liking?  It'll take some time, though - a half-day at least... and a few hundred gold?

[Happy to show off his skills and redeem himself]Absolutely!  I can make clothing thick enough to ward off this winter chill.  Would you like boots or a cloak?  Perhaps a scarf or hat?  Are gloves more to your liking?  It'll take some time, though - a half-day at most, and a few hundred gold.
Most excellent!  [Assuring player]It shouldn't take long at all to make.  Check back with me later... [Trying not to seem pushy]oh, and don't forget to bring enough gold with you.
Yes, yes!  Here it is.  [Proud]Mighty fine craftsmanship too, if I do say so myself.
No, no, it's not ready yet.  Give me a little more time.
[Explaining]My mending spell takes a stretch of time to complete, so you won't see any changes immediately.  I can already feel it working, however - [Excited]I can feel it in my toes!
[Confident and cheerful]Of course I can!  I'll cast it right away!

[Confident]Of course I can!  [Frowns with a lingering sigh]I'll need to find more components though... and guard my ship - or what's left of it.  [Igniting with a bright idea]Say, *I* could guard the ship while *you* retrieved my spell's components - I wrote them all down in that book over there.  Interested?

[Brightens, proud]There certainly is!  I've fashioned a spell of my own to mend the ship - "Oswald's Mending," I call it, quite catchy I think.  [Concerned about the ship]*Although,* she's never been quite this... [Searching for the right word]naked before.  [Quietly to himself in self-doubt]Question is, can I *still* repair her?
[A bit sad]Yes - worse than ever before.  [Angry, yet strangely impressed at the same time]And that [mal-strom]maelstrom of ice!  My goodness!  [Sad again, shaking his head]We never had a chance.
[Startled]Aahhh!  Oh, it's you.  I thought those [HAR-peez]harpies would be the death of me.  [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore sent me to - oh, this, I mean, she - this is my niece, [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie.
Yes, [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie, that's very interesting.  [Aside]I told her that her head was too small for her age.  Now she tries to fit her head in everything.

[Normal, merry self]In any event, as I was saying, [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore sent me.  The archdruid.  I mean - [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore didn't send me the archdruid.  [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore *is* the archdruid, and he sent me.  Here.  Whoo!  So... all aboard?
[matter of fact]Well, to [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar, of course.  [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore and the others need our help!  I had to evacuate most of the villagers before the [yawn tee]yuan-ti came.

[IH-zeh-lor]Iselore?  Why, he's the archdruid of [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar.  He replaced [AIR-un-del]Arundel almost, [trying to remember]hmm - thirty years ago.  Same time all that other nonsense happened.

Small?  Oh, why, yes, she is.  And that's why I had to move her.  The [yawn tee]yuan-ti started attacking [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar, and I moved the villagers to [TAR-gohs]Targos.  I couldn't leave little [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie there, though.
Oh, [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore told me!  He used the power of the Heartstone Gem to find you.  I came here as soon as I was done moving the villagers, hoping you would find your way out.
Things have settled down, more or less.  There are still a few goblins hiding under rocks in the plains, of course, but nothing the Ten-Towns can't deal with.  [sighs]All this over an insult.
[Uneasy]Well... all right.  But, we really should get to [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar as soon as possible.  Rest as long as you need to, but don't overdo it.

[Jovial]Oh, ha, ha, ha!  [Incredulous]Fly over the Severed Hand?!  There are Red Wizards in the valley, they'd blast us out of the sky worse than those women at the ice wall.  [Shuddering sigh]First we go to [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar, then [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore can help you.
Oh yes, the half-breeds.  They're trying to destroy the great oak!  But I'm getting ahead of myself.  [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore can explain it all better than I can.  Now, off we go!

Well, a lot of things.  The archdruid watches over [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar and protects the great oak from attackers.  [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore is an excellent archdruid.  But even he can only hold off the [yawn tee]yuan-ti for so long.
Oh, well, I suppose it's not common knowledge, but thirty years ago, two demons appeared in Icewind Dale.  They caused *all* sorts of trouble.
One of the demons, [BEL-hee-fet]Belhifet, killed our archdruid, [AIR-un-del]Arundel, to prevent a band of adventurers from using the Heartstone Gem to divine his army's location.

The adventurers eventually defeated the demons and returned the Heartstone Gem back to [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar, but it wasn't until almost a year later that [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore arrived to replace [AIR-un-del]Arundel.

A sacred relic of the druids of [sihl-VANN-us]Silvanus!  It has awesome powers of divination and healing magic.  It's the main reason why [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar is in a state of eternal summer.  The great oak is the other reason.

Like the Heartstone Gem, the great oak of [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar is sacred to the druids of [sihl-VANN-us]Silvanus.  Thousands of years ago, it sprouted in the wilderness and provided warmth to everything under its huge branches - a miracle!

But now, [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore's the only one protecting it.  The [yawn tee]yuan-ti have been trying to destroy it, and - well, [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore can tell you the rest when we get to [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar.

Excellent!  Just let me adjust a few things here, and - [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie, get into the restraining jacket and put your helmet on - [frustrated, Maralie's putting it on backwards]the *other* way around.  Yes.  [excited]All right!  Here we go!

Oh, yes!  You haven't heard?  The Legion sent envoys to the Ten-Towns months ago.  The whole reason this is happening is because the mayor of [BURN SHAN-dehr]Bryn Shander somehow insulted [ih-ZAIR]Isair and [mah-DAY]Madae.
Oh, there you are!  Are you ready to go yet?
There.  That wasn't so bad, was it?
[Admonishing]Oh, be quiet, you!  And while I'm talking to the nice adventurers, I better not catch you licking the potion bowls again!  It's going to get you into trouble someday.

The magic of the great oak makes the village under its branches warm year-round.  Since the Heartstone Gem was returned, the circle of warmth has grown - into a bigger circle, with a larger diameter, that is.

Well, you could take the paths down to the Fields of Slaughter, but [remembering]the Legion of the [kai-MEE-rah]Chimera has destroyed most of the trails.  [everything will be fine]Iselore will know what to do.  You can find him to the east, past the bridge and the mill.

She didn't always live with me, no.  [MAIR-ah-lee]Maralie was separated from my brother and his wife when goblins attacked their village.  We haven't heard from them in five years.  I'm more than happy to take care of her, though.
That?  That's where Mother [eh-GAY-nee-uh]Egenia raised [ih-ZAIR]Isair and [mah-DAY]Madae.  She's still buried there, but the villagers burned the house down.
It's a watchtower.  It used to be a grain tower, but [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore and [JURM-zee]Jermsy thought it would be best if it were turned into a watchtower.

A sacred relic of the druids of [sihl-VANN-us]Silvanus!  It has awesome powers of divination and healing magic.  It's the main reason why [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar is in a state of eternal summer.  The great oak is the other reason.

She - [tries to explain, can't]well, she - I'm sorry.  I could tell you, but I think [IH-zeh-lor]Iselore would be more helpful than I.  What happened with [eh-GAY-nee-uh]Egenia, [ih-ZAIR]Isair, [mah-DAY]Madae - even to the twins' mother - is a sad tale.
He's a sour grape.  His parents were killed by orcs when he was a child, during the troubles in the valley.  Now he's the captain of the town watch, and he has a thorn in his heart.
Back again!  I hope all is going well for you in the village.  Those [yawn tee]yuan-ti, they can sneak up on you!  Anyway, how can I help you?
Ha, ha, ha!  You did it!  You saved [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar.  I haven't been this happy since... well... since the last time a group of adventurers saved [KUL-duh-har]Kuldahar!
Uh, I think this is the first time we've met... isn't it?
Actually, you owe me five gold pieces, gnome.  Don't you remember?
Who are you?
I see.  I'm <CHARNAME>.  Who are you?
Then perhaps introductions would be in order.
Is this... ship yours?
Pleasure to meet you, Oswald.  Is that your ship?
Never mind, I was just kid-
Then you better *find* some g-
Uh, no thanks.  I'm <CHARNAME> - who are you?
I'll take it, thanks.  This should settle your debt to me... whoever you are.
Yes.  That one.  The one with the balloon on top.
No, I meant the imaginary one that's sailing through your head.
That ship, yes.
Lord Ulbrec asked if you would take us to the Western Pass.
It travels upon the air?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
What were you doing in Kuldahar?
Did the crash cause that damage to the hull?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
What were you doing in Kuldahar?
Sounds like the damage was pretty extensive.  How did you fix it?
Potions?
I... see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
Lab?
Like what components?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
Sounds like quite a list... especially the crushed diamonds.  Good thing you don't have to repair it again.
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
Rocks can't fly, Oswald.
What were you saying about your lab?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
You mentioned you flew from Kuldahar.  What were you doing there?
What were you saying about your lab?
Can you tell me about the damage to your ship again?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
Crashed?
Lab?
Your niece?
Sounds like your ship doesn't spend much time in the air.  How did you fix it?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
What do you do in Kuldahar?
Is the crash in Kuldahar what caused that damage to the hull?
I see.  I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
Tell me what?
Are you some kind of idiot?
Yes - yes, you did.  Do you have any potions to sell?
Yes - yes, you did.  Do you have any potions to sell?
Do you test these potions on yourself after making them?
Very well.  Let's see what you have.
On second thought, forget it.  However, I would like to hear more about this ship of yours.
Can we go for a ride on your airship?
What caused that damage to the ship's hull?
Perhaps some other time.  Farewell.
Do you have any potions to sell?
Do you have any potions to sell?
Can we go for a ride on your airship?
Did some of those... dangerous... potions cause that damage to the hull?
I'd like to hear more about your ship.
I must take my leave, Oswald.  Farewell.
I know.  Lord Ulbrec asked you to take me to the Western Pass.
What do you see?
Where have you seen these goblins?
Flaming oil?  Do you have any to sell?
Flaming oil?  Do you have any to sell?
I see. Thanks for the information, Oswald.
You mentioned flaming oil?  Do you have any to sell?
You mentioned flaming oil?  Do you have any to sell?
Can we go for a ride on your airship?
Is that what caused that damage to the hull?
I'd like to hear more about your ship.
I see. Thanks for the information, Oswald.
That's us, Oswald.
Stop acting like a half-wit, Oswald.  We're the group you're supposed to take.
We still need to take care of some things in town, Oswald.  We'll return.
Actually, could we see what potions you have first?
Actually, could we see what potions you have first?
Yes, we're ready.
For some time?
We might not come back at all?
Uh... in that case, I'm going to need a little more time to prepare for this journey.  And to raid the Trade Depot of every magical item I can buy.
I understand.  Let's go, Oswald.
Great.  Thanks, Oswald.
Yes, we're ready.
Actually, could we see what potions you have first?
Actually, could we see what potions you have first?
Can you tell me about your ship first?
We still need to take care of some things in town, Oswald.  We'll return.
Lord Ulbrec asked if you would take us to the Western Pass.
Not at the moment.  We were more interested in your ship.
Could we see what potions you have?
Could we see what potions you have?
Nothing today, thanks, Oswald.
Oswald!
Oswald, we need your help.
Oswald, wake up!
You, ah, don't mind if we take the ship for a jaunt around the mountains do you?
Oswald, snap out of it!
Hey, uh, no need to get up.  We'll just, uh, borrow a potion or two.
Oswald, on your feet now or we'll take your ship and drop you into Maer Dualdon!
All right, Oswald - very funny.  Now get up.
OSWALD!
Hello?  Is anybody in there?
Never mind.  Pleasant dreams, Oswald.
Sit tight, Oswald.  We'll return with help.
You didn't fall asleep at the helm.  You fell into in a trance after we crashed.  I nearly lost my voice trying to wake you.
You didn't fall asleep at the helm.  You fell into in a trance after we crashed.  The noise we made must have awakened you.
Yes, well... your ship's suffered some damage, Oswald.
Can you do anything with this boring beetle shell?
Can you do anything with this winter wolf pelt?
Can you do anything with this yeti pelt?
Could I see what potions you have?
Could I see what potions you have?
You're welcome.  Farewell.
Very well.  Let me see what you have.
Actually, do you realize your ship is severely damaged?
Actually, can you do anything with this boring beetle shell?
Actually, can you do anything with this winter wolf pelt?
Actually, can you do anything with this yeti pelt?
Perhaps some other time.  Farewell.
I've found the components for your mending spell.  Can you repair the ship now?
Do you realize your ship is damaged?
Do you realize your ship is still damaged?
Could I see what potions you have?
Could I see what potions you have?
Can you do anything with this boring beetle shell?
Can you do anything with this winter wolf pelt?
Can you do anything with this yeti pelt?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the plate mail ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the field plate ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the full plate ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the plate mail ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the field plate ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the full plate ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the wolf boots ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the yeti boots ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the wolf boots ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the yeti boots ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the wolf cloak ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the yeti cloak ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the wolf cloak ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the yeti cloak ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the wolf scarf ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the yeti scarf ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the wolf scarf ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the yeti scarf ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the wolf hat ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the yeti hat ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the wolf hat ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Is the yeti hat ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the wolf gloves ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the yeti gloves ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the wolf gloves ready?
I've got the gold you requested.  Are the yeti gloves ready?
No, I'm fine.  Farewell.
I'd like a lightweight suit of plate mail.
A lightweight suit of field plate armor sounds good.
A suit of full plate armor.
Actually, could I see what potions you have?
Actually, could I see what potions you have?
On second thought, can you do anything with this winter wolf pelt?
On second thought, can you do anything with this yeti pelt?
First, is the plate mail I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the field plate I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the full plate I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the plate mail I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the field plate I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the full plate I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, are the wolf boots I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
First, are the yeti boots I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
First, are the wolf boots I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
First, are the yeti boots I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the wolf cloak I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the yeti cloak I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the wolf cloak I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the yeti cloak I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the wolf scarf I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the yeti scarf I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the wolf scarf I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the yeti scarf I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the wolf hat I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the yeti hat I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the wolf hat I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the yeti hat I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, are the wolf gloves I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
First, are the yeti gloves I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
First, are the wolf gloves I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
First, are the yeti gloves I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for them.
I'll think about it.  Farewell.
I'd like a pair of boots.
A cloak.
The scarf, please.
A hat, I guess.
A pair of gloves sounds good.
Actually, could I see what potions you have?
Actually, could I see what potions you have?
On second thought, can you do anything with this boring beetle shell?
On second thought, can you do anything with this yeti pelt?
First, is the plate mail I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the field plate I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
First, is the full plate I asked for earlier ready?  I have the gold for it.
